page.title: 12CATCLIFFE GLASS KILN
page.content: The{Catcliffe glass kiln}was built around the year{1740}and stands{60' {high. Glass}and{pot ornaments}were made in the kiln. The Catcliffe kiln is{the oldest standing kiln in Europe. A workforce of eight men used to work at the kiln. At the top of the kiln the bricks are all worn out. The kiln has{six {archways.}Inside the kiln on the floor are all bits of glass and fallen bricks. Some of the glass is quite old. Today the kiln is not much use for the village. Lots of children meet there. Some children go and play in the kiln. Children from our school sometimes go to the kiln to{draw {pictures. The glass kiln means a lot to the {old people}as a reminder of the past. It's also{a well-known local landmark.
